p: Mainland Argentine extends from 22° to 55°S, encompassing subtropical and temperate latitudes ( Fig. 2). Along with its neighboring countries, it is located between the two great oceans of the Southern Hemisphere, the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans. This configuration reduces daily and annual thermal amplitudes in comparison to similar latitudes of the Northern Hemisphere. The Andes Mountains, with a height range of 2,600—6,000 m.a.s.l., also greatly influences the regional climate by preventing the passage of moisture from the Pacific Ocean ( Barros et al., 2015).
